description: The Alchemist follows Santiago, a shepherd on a quest to discover a hidden treasure, exploring themes of destiny and self-discovery along the way.
author: Paulo Coelho

description: The Great Gatsby tells the story of Jay Gatsby's obsession with Daisy Buchanan in the Roaring Twenties, offering a scathing critique of the American Dream.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

description: Little Women follows the lives of the four March sisters as they grow up and navigate their individual paths in life during and after the American Civil War.
author: Louisa May Alcott

description: To Kill a Mockingbird explores racial injustice in the American South, through the eyes of Scout Finch as her father, lawyer Atticus Finch, defends an innocent black man.
author: Harper Lee

description: The Hobbit follows the adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on an unexpected journey to reclaim treasure guarded by a dragon.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

description: The Book Thief is set in Nazi Germany and narrated by Death, following a young girl, Liesel, as she steals books and learns the power of words during WWII.
author: Markus Zusak

description: The Handmaid's Tale is set in a dystopian future where fertility is scarce, and women are subjugated, following the journey of Offred, a handmaid in the Republic of Gilead.
author: Margaret Atwood

description: The Catcher in the Rye follows the troubled teenage Holden Caulfield, who narrates his disillusionment with society and the struggles of growing up.
author: J.D. Salinger

description: Pride and Prejudice explores themes of love, class, and marriage through the complex relationships of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy in 19th-century England.
author: Jane Austen

description: Moby Dick tells the story of Ishmael, a sailor who joins Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt the elusive white whale, Moby Dick.
author: Herman Melville

description: Brave New World is set in a future society where people are genetically engineered and conditioned for predetermined roles, exploring themes of conformity and freedom.
author: Aldous Huxley

product_title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone follows a young boy, Harry, who discovers he is a wizard and embarks on a journey to defeat dark forces at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
author: J.K. Rowling

description: The Lord of the Rings follows the journey of a hobbit, Frodo, as he embarks on a quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth from darkness.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

description: War and Peace is an epic novel that blends historical events with fictional characters, focusing on the Napoleonic Wars and the Russian aristocracy.
author: Leo Tolstoy

description: Crime and Punishment follows Rodion Raskolnikov, a troubled student who commits murder in a bid to prove his superiority. As he struggles with guilt and justification, Dostoevsky explores deep themes of morality and redemption.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

description: The Kite Runner is a story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set in Afghanistan, following the life of Amir and his complicated relationship with Hassan.
author: Khaled Hosseini

description: A Tale of Two Cities is set during the French Revolution and follows the story of Charles Darnay and Sydney Carton, two men who share a love for the same woman.
author: Charles Dickens

description: Frankenstein tells the tale of Dr. Victor Frankenstein, who creates a monster and the tragic consequences of playing god with life and death.
author: Mary Shelley

description: The Picture of Dorian Gray is a novel that explores themes of beauty, vanity, and the consequences of a life devoted to pleasure and excess, following the life of Dorian Gray.
author: Oscar Wilde

product_title: All the Light We Cannot See
description: All the Light We Cannot See tells the story of a blind French girl and a German soldier whose lives become intertwined during World War II.
author: Anthony Doerr

description: The Nightingale is a novel about two sisters in France during World War II who struggle to survive and resist the German occupation in their own ways.
author: Kristin Hannah
